data.name: 312.8: Confidentiality, security, and integrity of personal information collected from children.
data.description: The operator must establish and maintain reasonable procedures to protect the confidentiality, security, and integrity of personal information collected from children.

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Delete Policy
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has a policy to prevent deletion of logs without an MFA token
tests.more_info: To provide additional security, CloudTrail logging buckets should require an MFA token to delete objects
tests.recommended_action: Enable MFA delete on the CloudTrail bucket

tests.title: Excessive Security Groups
tests.description: Determine if there are an excessive number of security groups in the account
tests.more_info: Keeping the number of security groups to a minimum helps reduce the attack surface of an account. Rather than creating new groups with the same rules for each project, common rules should be grouped under the same security groups. For example, instead of adding port 22 from a known IP to every group, create a single "SSH" security group which can be used on multiple instances.
tests.recommended_action: Limit the number of security groups to prevent accidental authorizations

results.message: Acceptable number of security groups: 1 groups present
Acceptable number of security groups: 1 groups present
Acceptable number of security groups: 1 groups present
Acceptable number of security groups: 1 groups present
Acceptable number of security groups: 1 groups present

Acceptable number of security groups: 1 groups present

Acceptable number of security groups: 1 groups present

tests.title: Minimum Password Length
tests.description: Ensures password policy requires a password of at least a minimum number of characters
tests.more_info: A strong password policy enforces minimum length, expirations, reuse, and symbol usage
tests.recommended_action: Increase the minimum length requirement for the password policy
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for minimum password length will be set to the value set by the user. Otherwise, it will default to 14.

results.message: Account does not have a password policy

tests.title: Password Requires Symbols
tests.description: Ensures password policy requires the use of symbols
tests.more_info: A strong password policy enforces minimum length, expirations, reuse, and symbol usage
tests.recommended_action: Update the password policy to require the use of symbols
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for password requires symbols will be set to true.

results.message: Account does not have a password policy

tests.title: Maximum Password Age
tests.description: Ensures password policy requires passwords to be reset every 180 days
tests.more_info: A strong password policy enforces minimum length, expirations, reuse, and symbol usage
tests.recommended_action: Descrease the maximum allowed age of passwords for the password policy
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for maximum password age will be set to the value set by the user. Otherwise, it will default to 179.

results.message: Account does not have a password policy

tests.title: Password Reuse Prevention
tests.description: Ensures password policy prevents previous password reuse
tests.more_info: A strong password policy enforces minimum length, expirations, reuse, and symbol usage
tests.recommended_action: Increase the minimum previous passwords that can be reused to 24.
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for password reuse prevention will be set to the value set by the user. Otherwise, it will default to 24.

results.message: Account does not have a password policy

tests.title: Root MFA Enabled
tests.description: Ensures a multi-factor authentication device is enabled for the root account
tests.more_info: The root account should have an MFA device setup to enable two-factor authentication.
tests.recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the root account and then use an IAM user for managing services

results.message: An MFA device was not found for the root account

tests.title: Root Access Keys
tests.description: Ensures the root account is not using access keys
tests.more_info: The root account should avoid using access keys. Since the root account has full permissions across the entire account, creating access keys for it only increases the chance that they are compromised. Instead, create IAM users with predefined roles.
tests.recommended_action: Remove access keys for the root account and setup IAM users with limited permissions instead

results.message: Access keys were not found for the root account

tests.title: Users MFA Enabled
tests.description: Ensures a multi-factor authentication device is enabled for all users within the account
tests.more_info: User accounts should have an MFA device setup to enable two-factor authentication
tests.recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the user account

tests.title: Access Keys Rotated
tests.description: Ensures access keys are not older than 180 days in order to reduce accidental exposures
tests.more_info: Access keys should be rotated frequently to avoid having them accidentally exposed.
tests.recommended_action: To rotate an access key, first create a new key, replace the key and secret throughout your app or scripts, then set the previous key to disabled. Once you ensure that no services are broken, then fully delete the old key.

tests.title: Access Keys Last Used
tests.description: Detects access keys that have not been used for a period of time and that should be decommissioned
tests.more_info: Having numerous, unused access keys extends the attack surface. Access keys should be removed if they are no longer being used.
tests.recommended_action: Log into the IAM portal and remove the offending access key.

results.message: No users using access keys found

tests.title: Access Keys Extra
tests.description: Detects the use of more than one access key by any single user
tests.more_info: Having more than one access key for a single user increases the chance of accidental exposure. Each account should only have one key that defines the users permissions.
tests.recommended_action: Remove the extra access key for the specified user.

results.message: No users using access keys found

tests.title: RDS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures at-rest encryption is setup for RDS instances
tests.more_info: AWS provides at-read encryption for RDS instances which should be enabled to ensure the integrity of data stored within the databases.
tests.recommended_action: RDS does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the instance has been launched, so a new instance will need to be created with encryption enabled.

tests.title: RDS Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures RDS instances are not launched into the public cloud
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, RDS instances should not have a public endpoint and should be accessed from within a VPC only.
tests.recommended_action: Remove the public endpoint from the RDS instance

tests.title: Password Expiration
tests.description: Ensures password policy enforces a password expiration
tests.more_info: A strong password policy enforces minimum length, expirations, reuse, and symbol usage
tests.recommended_action: Enable password expiration for the account
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for password expiration will be set to true.

results.message: Account does not have a password policy

tests.title: Password Requires Lowercase
tests.description: Ensures password policy requires at least one lowercase letter
tests.more_info: A strong password policy enforces minimum length, expirations, reuse, and symbol usage
tests.recommended_action: Update the password policy to require the use of lowercase letters
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for password requires lowercase will be set to true.

results.message: Account does not have a password policy

tests.title: Password Requires Numbers
tests.description: Ensures password policy requires the use of numbers
tests.more_info: A strong password policy enforces minimum length, expirations, reuse, and symbol usage
tests.recommended_action: Update the password policy to require the use of numbers
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for password requires numbers will be set to true.

results.message: Account does not have a password policy

tests.title: Password Requires Uppercase
tests.description: Ensures password policy requires at least one uppercase letter
tests.more_info: A strong password policy enforces minimum length, expirations, reuse, and symbol usage
tests.recommended_action: Update the password policy to require the use of uppercase letters
tests.remediation_description: The password policy for password requires uppercase will be set to true.

results.message: Account does not have a password policy

tests.title: Config Service Enabled
tests.description: Ensures the AWS Config Service is enabled to detect changes to account resources
tests.more_info: The AWS Config Service tracks changes to a number of resources in an AWS account and is invaluable in determining how account changes affect other resources and in recovery in the event of an account intrusion or accidental configuration change.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the AWS Config Service for all regions and resources in an account. Ensure that it is properly recording and delivering logs.

results.message: Config Service is not monitoring global services

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Access Logging
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has access logging enabled to detect tampering of log files
tests.more_info: CloudTrail buckets should utilize access logging for an additional layer of auditing. If the log files are deleted or modified in any way, the additional access logs can help determine who made the changes.
tests.recommended_action: Enable access logging on the CloudTrail bucket from the S3 console

tests.title: CloudTrail Encryption
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail encryption at rest is enabled for logs
tests.more_info: CloudTrail log files contain sensitive information about an account and should be encrypted at rest for additional protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail log encryption through the CloudTrail console or API
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected Cloud trails will be enabled.

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Private
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket is not publicly accessible
tests.more_info: CloudTrail buckets contain large amounts of sensitive account data and should only be accessible by logged in users.
tests.recommended_action: Set the S3 bucket access policy for all CloudTrail buckets to only allow known users to access its files.

tests.title: Default Security Group
tests.description: Ensure the default security groups block all traffic by default
tests.more_info: The default security group is often used for resources launched without a defined security group. For this reason, the default rules should be to block all traffic to prevent an accidental exposure.
tests.recommended_action: Update the rules for the default security group to deny all traffic by default

results.message: Default security group has 1 inbound and 1 outbound rules
Default security group has 1 inbound and 1 outbound rules
Default security group has 1 inbound and 1 outbound rules
Default security group has 1 inbound and 1 outbound rules

Default security group has 1 inbound and 1 outbound rules

tests.title: Public S3 CloudFront Origin
tests.description: Detects the use of an S3 bucket as a CloudFront origin without an origin access identity
tests.more_info: When S3 is used as an origin for a CloudFront bucket, the contents should be kept private and an origin access identity should allow CloudFront access. This prevents someone from bypassing the caching benefits that CloudFront provides, repeatedly loading objects directly from S3, and amassing a large access bill.
tests.recommended_action: Create an origin access identity for CloudFront, then make the contents of the S3 bucket private.

tests.title: VPC Multiple Subnets
tests.description: Ensures that VPCs have multiple subnets to provide a layered architecture
tests.more_info: VPCs should be designed to have separate public and private subnets, ideally across availability zones, enabling a DMZ-style architecture.
tests.recommended_action: Create at least two subnets in each VPC, utilizing one for public traffic and the other for private traffic.

There are 3 subnets used in one VPC.

tests.title: CloudWatch Monitoring Metrics
tests.description: Ensures metric filters are setup for CloudWatch logs to detect security risks from CloudTrail.
tests.more_info: Sending CloudTrail logs to CloudWatch is only useful if metrics are setup to detect risky activity from those logs. There are numerous metrics that should be used. For the exact filter patterns, please see this plugin on GitHub: https://github.com/cloudsploit/scans/blob/master/plugins/aws/cloudwatchlogs/monitoringMetrics.js
tests.recommended_action: Enable metric filters to detect malicious activity in CloudTrail logs sent to CloudWatch.

tests.title: Redshift Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures at-rest encryption is setup for Redshift clusters
tests.more_info: AWS provides at-read encryption for Redshift clusters which should be enabled to ensure the integrity of data stored within the cluster.
tests.recommended_action: Redshift does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the cluster has been launched, so a new cluster will need to be created with encryption enabled.

tests.title: Redshift Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures Redshift clusters are not launched into the public cloud
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, Redshift clusters should not have a public endpoint and should be accessed from within a VPC only.
tests.recommended_action: Remove the public endpoint from the Redshift cluster

tests.title: Insecure CloudFront Protocols
tests.description: Detects the use of insecure HTTPS SSL/TLS protocols for use with HTTPS traffic between viewers and CloudFront
tests.more_info: CloudFront supports SSLv3 and TLSv1 protocols for use with HTTPS traffic, but only TLSv1.1 or higher should be used unless there is a valid business justification to support the older, insecure SSLv3.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that traffic sent between viewers and CloudFront is passed over HTTPS and uses TLSv1.1 or higher.

tests.title: Instance IAM Role
tests.description: Ensures EC2 instances are using an IAM role instead of hard-coded AWS credentials
tests.more_info: IAM roles should be assigned to all instances to enable them to access AWS resources. Using an IAM role is more secure than hard-coding AWS access keys into application code.
tests.recommended_action: Attach an IAM role to the EC2 instance

tests.title: Encrypted AMI
tests.description: Ensures EBS-backed AMIs are configured to use encryption
tests.more_info: AMIs with unencrypted data volumes can be used to launch unencrypted instances that place data at risk.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all AMIs have encrypted EBS volumes.

tests.title: CloudFront HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures CloudFront distributions are configured to redirect non-HTTPS traffic to HTTPS.
tests.more_info: For maximum security, CloudFront distributions can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections or to redirect HTTP connections to HTTPS.
tests.recommended_action: Remove HTTP-only listeners from distributions.
tests.remediation_description: CloudFront distribution will be configured to only accept HTTPS connections or to redirect HTTP connections to HTTPS.

tests.title: ELB HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures ELBs are configured to only accept connections on HTTPS ports.
tests.more_info: For maximum security, ELBs can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections. Standard HTTP connections  will be blocked. This should only be done if the  client application is configured to query HTTPS  directly and not rely on a redirect from HTTP.
tests.recommended_action: Remove non-HTTPS listeners from load balancer.
tests.remediation_description: All HTTP Listeners will be deleted

tests.title: Open All Ports Protocols
tests.description: Determine if security group has all ports or protocols open to the public
tests.more_info: Security groups should be created on a per-service basis and avoid allowing all ports or protocols.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the security group to specify a specific port and protocol to allow.

results.message: Security group: sg-072c5bfd6aadfc30d (default) does not have all ports or protocols open to the public

Security group: sg-0e596dc5603d01971 (default) does not have all ports or protocols open to the public

tests.title: EBS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures EBS volumes are encrypted at rest
tests.more_info: EBS volumes should have at-rest encryption enabled through AWS using KMS. If the volume is used for a root volume, the instance must be launched from an AMI that has been encrypted as well.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption for EBS volumes.

tests.title: SQS Cross Account Access
tests.description: Ensures SQS policies disallow cross-account access
tests.more_info: SQS policies should be carefully restricted to prevent publishing or reading from the queue from unexpected sources. Queue policies can be used to limit these privileges.
tests.recommended_action: Update the SQS policy to prevent access from external accounts.

tests.title: SQS Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures SQS encryption is enabled
tests.more_info: Messages sent to SQS queues can be encrypted using KMS server-side encryption. Existing queues can be modified to add encryption with minimal overhead.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS for all SQS queues.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected SQS queues will be enabled.

tests.title: Users Password Last Used
tests.description: Detects users with password logins that have not been used for a period of time and that should be decommissioned
tests.more_info: Having numerous, unused user accounts extends the attack surface. If users do not log into their accounts for more than the defined period of time, the account should be deleted.
tests.recommended_action: Delete old user accounts that allow password-based logins and have not been used recently.

tests.title: KMS Key Policy
tests.description: Validates the KMS key policy to ensure least-privilege access.
tests.more_info: KMS key policies should be designed to limit the number of users who can perform encrypt and decrypt operations. Each application should use its own key to avoid over exposure.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the KMS key policy to remove any wildcards and limit the number of users and roles that can perform encrypt and decrypt operations using the key.

tests.title: ACM Certificate Validation
tests.description: ACM certificates should be configured to use DNS validation.
tests.more_info: With DNS validation, ACM will automatically renew certificates before they expire, as long as the DNS CNAME record is in place.
tests.recommended_action: Configure ACM managed certificates to use DNS validation.

tests.title: DynamoDB KMS Encryption
tests.description: Ensures DynamoDB tables are encrypted using a customer-owned KMS key.
tests.more_info: DynamoDB tables can be encrypted using AWS-owned or customer-owned KMS keys. Customer keys should be used to ensure control over the encryption seed data.
tests.recommended_action: Create a new DynamoDB table using a CMK KMS key.
tests.remediation_description: The impacted DynamoDB table will be configured to use either KMS encryption with AWS managed CMK, or CMK-based encryption if a KMS key ID is provided.

tests.title: Lambda Public Access
tests.description: Ensures Lambda functions are not accessible globally
tests.more_info: The Lambda function execution policy should not allow public invocation of the function.
tests.recommended_action: Update the Lambda policy to prevent access from the public.

results.message: Function does not have an access policy
Function does not have an access policy

tests.title: EFS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that EFS volumes are encrypted at rest
tests.more_info: EFS offers data at rest encryption using keys managed through AWS Key Management Service (KMS).
tests.recommended_action: Encryption of data at rest can only be enabled during file system creation. Encryption of data in transit is configured when mounting your file system. 1. Backup your data in not encrypted efs 2. Recreate the EFS and select 'Enable encryption of data at rest'

tests.title: Workgroup Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures Athena workgroups are configured to encrypt all data at rest.
tests.more_info: Athena workgroups support full server-side encryption for all data at rest which should be enabled.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption at rest for all Athena workgroups.
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected workgroups will be enabled.

tests.title: Workgroup Enforce Configuration
tests.description: Ensures Athena workgroups do not allow clients to override configuration options.
tests.more_info: Athena workgroups support the ability for clients to override configuration options, including encryption requirements. This setting should be disabled to enforce encryption mandates.
tests.recommended_action: Disable the ability for clients to override Athena workgroup configuration options.

tests.title: EC2 Instance Key Based Login
tests.description: Ensures EC2 instances have associated keys for password-less SSH login
tests.more_info: AWS allows EC2 instances to be launched with a specified PEM key for SSH login which should be used instead of user and password login.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure each EC2 instance has an associated SSH key and disable password login.

tests.title: Shield Advanced Enabled
tests.description: Ensures AWS Shield Advanced is setup and properly configured
tests.more_info: AWS Shield Advanced provides enhanced DDOS protection for all enrolled services within a subscribed account. Subscriptions should be active.
tests.recommended_action: Enable AWS Shield Advanced for the account.

tests.title: Shield Emergency Contacts
tests.description: Ensures AWS Shield emergency contacts are configured
tests.more_info: AWS Shield Emergency contacts should be configured so that AWS can contact an account representative in the event of a DDOS event.
tests.recommended_action: Configure emergency contacts within AWS Shield for the account.

tests.title: Shield Protections
tests.description: Ensures AWS Shield Advanced is configured to protect account resources
tests.more_info: Once AWS Shield Advanced is enabled, it can be applied to resources within the account including ELBs, CloudFront.
tests.recommended_action: Enable AWS Shield Advanced on resources within the account.

tests.title: EKS Private Endpoint
tests.description: Ensures the private endpoint setting is enabled for EKS clusters
tests.more_info: EKS private endpoints can be used to route all traffic between the Kubernetes worker and control plane nodes over a private VPC endpoint rather than across the public internet.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the private endpoint setting for all EKS clusters.

tests.title: EKS Security Groups
tests.description: Ensures the EKS control plane only allows inbound traffic on port 443.
tests.more_info: The EKS control plane only requires port 443 access. Security groups for the control plane should not add additional port access.
tests.recommended_action: Configure security groups for the EKS control plane to allow access only on port 443.

tests.title: ECR Repository Policy
tests.description: Ensures ECR repository policies do not enable global or public access to images
tests.more_info: ECR repository policies should limit access to images to known IAM entities and AWS accounts and avoid the use of account-level wildcards.
tests.recommended_action: Update the repository policy to limit access to known IAM entities.

tests.title: IAM Role Policies
tests.description: Ensures IAM role policies are properly scoped with specific permissions
tests.more_info: Policies attached to IAM roles should be scoped to least-privileged access and avoid the use of wildcards.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all IAM roles are scoped to specific services and API calls.

results.message: Role does not have overly-permissive policy
Role does not have overly-permissive policy
Role does not have overly-permissive policy
Role does not have overly-permissive policy

tests.title: RDS Snapshot Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is enabled for RDS snapshots to ensure encryption of data at rest.
tests.more_info: AWS provides encryption for RDS snapshots which should be enabled to ensure that all data at rest is encrypted.
tests.recommended_action: Copy the snapshot to a new snapshot that is encrypted and delete the old snapshot.

tests.title: Users Password And Keys
tests.description: Detects whether users with a console password are also using access keys
tests.more_info: Access keys should only be assigned to machine users and should not be used for accounts that have console password access.
tests.recommended_action: Remove access keys from all users with console access.

tests.title: Root Hardware MFA
tests.description: Ensures the root account is using a hardware MFA device
tests.more_info: The root account should use a hardware MFA device for added security, rather than a virtual device which could be more easily compromised.
tests.recommended_action: Enable a hardware MFA device for the root account and disable any virtual devices

tests.title: S3 Bucket Encryption
tests.description: Ensures object encryption is enabled on S3 buckets
tests.more_info: S3 object encryption provides fully-managed encryption of all objects uploaded to an S3 bucket.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CMK KMS-based encryption for all S3 buckets.
tests.remediation_description: The impacted bucket will be configured to use either AES-256 encryption, or CMK-based encryption if a KMS key ID is provided.

tests.title: ElasticSearch Encrypted Domain
tests.description: Ensures ElasticSearch domains are encrypted with KMS
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should be encrypted to ensure data at rest is secured.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure encryption-at-rest is enabled for all ElasticSearch domains.
tests.remediation_description: ES domain will be encrypted with KMS.

tests.title: ElasticSearch Node To Node Encryption
tests.description: Ensures ElasticSearch domain traffic is encrypted in transit between nodes
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should use node-to-node encryption to ensure data in transit remains encrypted using TLS 1.2.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure node-to-node encryption is enabled for all ElasticSearch domains.
tests.remediation_description: ES domain will be configured to use node-to-node encryption.

tests.title: ElasticSearch Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures ElasticSearch domains are configured to log data to CloudWatch
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should be configured with logging enabled with logs sent to CloudWatch for analysis and long-term storage.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure logging is enabled and a CloudWatch log group is specified for each ElasticSearch domain.

tests.title: ElasticSearch HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures ElasticSearch domains are configured to enforce HTTPS connections
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should be configured to enforce HTTPS connections for all clients to ensure encryption of data in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure HTTPS connections are enforced for all ElasticSearch domains.
tests.remediation_description: ES domain will be configured to enforce HTTPS.

tests.title: Insecure EC2 Metadata Options
tests.description: Ensures EC2 instance metadata is updated to require HttpTokens or disable HttpEndpoint
tests.more_info: The new EC2 metadata service prevents SSRF attack escalations from accessing the sensitive instance metadata endpoints.
tests.recommended_action: Update instance metadata options to use IMDSv2

tests.title: S3 Bucket Website Enabled
tests.description: Ensures S3 buckets are not configured with static website hosting
tests.more_info: S3 buckets should not be configured with static website hosting with public objects. Instead, a CloudFront distribution should be configured with an origin access identity.
tests.recommended_action: Disable S3 bucket static website hosting in favor or CloudFront distributions.

tests.title: S3 Bucket Public Access Block
tests.description: Ensures S3 public access block is enabled on all buckets or for AWS account
tests.more_info: Blocking S3 public access at the account level or bucket-level ensures objects are not accidentally exposed.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the S3 public access block on all S3 buckets or for AWS account.

tests.title: GuardDuty is Enabled
tests.description: Ensures GuardDuty is enabled
tests.more_info: GuardDuty provides threat intelligence by analyzing several AWS data sources for security risks and should be enabled in all accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Enable GuardDuty for all AWS accounts.

tests.title: GuardDuty Master Account
tests.description: Ensures GuardDuty master account is correct
tests.more_info: Organizations with large numbers of AWS accounts should configure GuardDuty findings from all member accounts to be sent to a consistent master account.
tests.recommended_action: Configure the member account to send GuardDuty findings to a known master account.

tests.title: S3 Bucket Enforce Object Encryption
tests.description: Ensures S3 bucket policies do not allow uploads of unencrypted objects
tests.more_info: S3 bucket policies can be configured to block uploads of objects that are not encrypted.
tests.recommended_action: Set the S3 bucket policy to deny uploads of unencrypted objects.

tests.title: DMS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures DMS encryption is enabled using a CMK
tests.more_info: Data sent through the data migration service is encrypted using KMS. Encryption is enabled by default, but it is recommended to use customer managed keys.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS CMKs for all DMS replication instances.

tests.title: ELBv2 HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures ELBs are configured to only accept connections on HTTPS ports.
tests.more_info: For maximum security, ELBs can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections. Standard HTTP connections  will be blocked. This should only be done if the  client application is configured to query HTTPS  directly and not rely on a redirect from HTTP.
tests.recommended_action: Remove non-HTTPS listeners from load balancer.
tests.remediation_description: All HTTP Listeners will be deleted

tests.title: CloudFormation Plaintext Parameters
tests.description: Ensures CloudFormation parameters that reference sensitive values are configured to use NoEcho.
tests.more_info: CloudFormation supports the NoEcho property for sensitive values, which should be used to ensure secrets are not exposed in the CloudFormation UI and APIs.
tests.recommended_action: Update the sensitive parameters to use the NoEcho property.

tests.title: EC2 LaunchWizard Security Groups
tests.description: Ensures security groups created by the EC2 launch wizard are not used
tests.more_info: The EC2 launch wizard frequently creates insecure security groups that are exposed publicly. These groups should not be used and custom security groups should be created instead.
tests.recommended_action: Delete the launch wizard security group and replace it with a custom security group.

tests.title: IAM Role Last Used
tests.description: Ensures IAM roles that have not been used within the given time frame are deleted.
tests.more_info: IAM roles that have not been used for a long period may contain old access policies that could allow unintended access to resources if accidentally attached to new services. These roles should be deleted.
tests.recommended_action: Delete IAM roles that have not been used within the expected time frame.

results.message: IAM role: aqua-cspm-security-scanner-AquaCSPMRole-1EJXK17YOUJB3 has not been used
IAM role: aqua-cspm-security-scanner-LambdaExecutionRole-1TWJRL74GAFXI has not been used

tests.title: SQL Server TLS Version
tests.description: Ensures RDS SQL Servers do not allow outdated TLS certificate versions
tests.more_info: TLS 1.2 or higher should be used for all TLS connections to RDS. A parameter group can be used to enforce this connection type.
tests.recommended_action: Create a parameter group that contains the TLS version restriction and limit access to TLS 1.2 or higher
tests.remediation_description: TLS 1.2 will be enabled, TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 will be disabled

tests.title: Amazon Comprehend Volume Encryption
tests.description: Ensures the Comprehend service is using encryption for all volumes storing data at rest.
tests.more_info: Comprehend supports using KMS keys to encrypt data at rest, which should be enabled.
tests.recommended_action: Enable volume encryption for the Comprehend job

tests.title: Amazon Comprehend Output Result Encryption
tests.description: Ensures the Comprehend service is using encryption for all result output.
tests.more_info: Comprehend supports using KMS keys to result output, which should be enabled.
tests.recommended_action: Enable output result encryption for the Comprehend job

tests.title: DynamoDB Accelerator Cluster Encryption
tests.description: Ensures DynamoDB Cluster Accelerator DAX clusters have encryption enabled.
tests.more_info: DynamoDB Clusters Accelerator DAX clusters should have encryption at rest enabled to secure data from unauthorized access.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption for DAX cluster.

tests.title: ElasticBeanstalk Managed Platform Updates
tests.description: Ensures ElasticBeanstalk applications are configured to use managed updates.
tests.more_info: Environments for an application should be configured to allow platform managed updates.
tests.recommended_action: Update the environment to enable managed updates.

tests.title: Object Lock Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that AWS CloudTrail S3 buckets use Object Lock for data protection and regulatory compliance.
tests.more_info: CloudTrail buckets should be configured to have object lock enabled. You can use it to prevent an object from being deleted or overwritten for a fixed amount of time or indefinitely.
tests.recommended_action: Edit trail to use a bucket with object locking enabled.

tests.title: ELBv2 Deletion Protection
tests.description: Ensures ELBv2 load balancers are configured with deletion protection.
tests.more_info: ELBv2 load balancers should be configured with deletion protection to prevent accidentaldeletion of live resources in production environments.
tests.recommended_action: Update ELBv2 load balancers to use deletion protection to prevent accidental deletion

tests.title: EMR Encryption In Transit
tests.description: Ensures encryption in transit is enabled for EMR clusters
tests.more_info: EMR clusters should be configured to enable encryption in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Update security configuration associated with EMR cluster to enable encryption in transit.

tests.title: EMR Encryption At Rest
tests.description: Ensures encryption at rest for local disks is enabled for EMR clusters
tests.more_info: EMR clusters should be configured to enable encryption at rest for local disks.
tests.recommended_action: Update security configuration associated with EMR cluster to enable encryption at rest for local disks.

tests.title: Cross-Account Access External ID and MFA
tests.description: Ensures that either MFA or external IDs are used to access AWS roles.
tests.more_info: IAM roles should be configured to require either a shared external ID or use an MFA device when assuming the role.
tests.recommended_action: Update the IAM role to either require MFA or use an external ID.

results.message: Cross-account role requires MFA/external ID for all accounts
IAM role does not contain cross-account statements
IAM role does not contain cross-account statements
IAM role does not contain cross-account statements

tests.title: S3 Secure Transport Enabled
tests.description: Ensure AWS S3 buckets enforce SSL to secure data in transit
tests.more_info: S3 buckets should be configured to strictly require SSL connections to deny unencrypted HTTP requests when dealing with sensitive data.
tests.recommended_action: Update S3 bucket policy to enforse SSL to secure data in transit.

tests.title: SNS Topic CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Amazon SNS topics are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs).
tests.more_info: AWS SNS topics should be  encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs) instead of AWS managed-keysin order to have a more granular control over the SNS data-at-rest encryption and decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Update SNS topics to use Customer Master Keys (CMKs) for Server-Side Encryption.

tests.title: Launch Configuration Referencing Missing Security Groups
tests.description: Ensures that Auto Scaling launch configurations are not utilizing missing security groups.
tests.more_info: Auto Scaling launch configuration should utilize an active security group to ensure safety of managed instances.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the launch configuration security group has not been deleted. If so, remove it from launch configurations

tests.title: Web-Tier Launch Configurations IAM Roles
tests.description: Ensures that Web-Tier Auto Scaling launch configuration is configured to use a customer created IAM role.
tests.more_info: Web-Tier Auto Scaling launch configuration should have a customer created Web-Tier IAM role to provide necessary credentials to access AWS services.
tests.recommended_action: Update Web-Tier Auto Scaling launch configuration and attach a customer created Web-Tier IAM role

tests.title: App-Tier Launch Configurations IAM Roles
tests.description: Ensures that App-Tier Auto Scaling launch configuration is configured to use a customer created IAM role.
tests.more_info: App-Tier Auto Scaling launch configuration should have a customer created App-Tier IAM role to provide necessary credentials to access AWS services.
tests.recommended_action: Update App-Tier Auto Scaling launch configuration and attach a customer created App-Tier IAM role

tests.title: Open RFC 1918
tests.description: Ensures EC2 security groups are configured to deny inbound traffic from RFC-1918 CIDRs
tests.more_info: RFC-1918 IP addresses are considered reserved private addresses and should not be used in security groups.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the security group to deny private reserved addresses for inbound traffic

tests.title: Allowed Custom Ports
tests.description: Ensures that security groups does not allow public access to any port.
tests.more_info: Security groups should be used to restrict access to ports from known networks.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the security group to ensure the ports are not exposed publicly

tests.title: IAM User Unauthorized to Edit
tests.description: Ensures AWS IAM users that are not authorized to edit IAM access policies are decommissioned.
tests.more_info: Only authorized IAM users should have permission to edit IAM access policies to prevent any unauthorized requests.
tests.recommended_action: Update unauthorized IAM users to remove permissions to edit IAM access policies.

tests.title: RDS CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensures RDS instances are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys(CMKs).
tests.more_info: RDS instances should be encrypted with Customer Master Keys in order to have full control over data encryption and decryption.
tests.recommended_action: RDS does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the instance has been launched, so a new instance will need to be created with KMS CMK encryption enabled.

tests.title: RDS Transport Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures RDS SQL Server instances have Transport Encryption enabled.
tests.more_info: Parameter group associated with the RDS instance should have transport encryption enabled to handle encryption and decryption
tests.recommended_action: Update the parameter group associated with the RDS instance to have rds.force_ssl set to true

tests.title: SNS Topic Encrypted
tests.description: Ensures that Amazon SNS topics enforce Server-Side Encryption (SSE)
tests.more_info: SNS topics should enforce Server-Side Encryption (SSE) to secure data at rest. SSE protects the contents of messages in Amazon SNS topics using keys managed in AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS).
tests.recommended_action: Enable Server-Side Encryption to protect the content of SNS topic messages.
tests.remediation_description: Server-Side Encryption to protect the content of SNS topic messages will be enabled.

tests.title: SQS Public Access
tests.description: Ensures that SQS queues are not publicly accessible
tests.more_info: SQS queues should be not be publicly accessible to prevent unauthorized actions.
tests.recommended_action: Update the SQS queue policy to prevent public access.

tests.title: Redshift Cluster CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Redshift clusters are encrypted using KMS customer master keys (CMKs)
tests.more_info: KMS CMKs should be used to encrypt redshift clusters in order to have full control over data encryption and decryption.
tests.recommended_action: Update Redshift clusters encryption configuration to use KMS CMKs instead of AWS managed-keys.

tests.title: Redshift Parameter Group SSL Required
tests.description: Ensures AWS Redshift non-default parameter group associated with Redshift cluster require SSL connection.
tests.more_info: Redshift parameter group associated with Redshift cluster should be configured to require SSL to secure data in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Update Redshift parameter groups to have require-ssl parameter set to true.

data.name: 312.10: Data retention and deletion requirements
data.description: An operator of a Web site or online service shall retain personal information collected online from a child for only as long as is reasonably necessary to fulfill the purpose for which the information was collected.

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Delete Policy
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has a policy to prevent deletion of logs without an MFA token
tests.more_info: To provide additional security, CloudTrail logging buckets should require an MFA token to delete objects
tests.recommended_action: Enable MFA delete on the CloudTrail bucket

tests.title: ELBv2 Deletion Protection
tests.description: Ensures ELBv2 load balancers are configured with deletion protection.
tests.more_info: ELBv2 load balancers should be configured with deletion protection to prevent accidentaldeletion of live resources in production environments.
tests.recommended_action: Update ELBv2 load balancers to use deletion protection to prevent accidental deletion
